title: Refraction - graph to determine unknown n

content.description:
A student measures the incident angle <math alttext="theta sub i" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> and the refracted angle <math alttext="theta sub r" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>θ</mi> <mi>r</mi> </msub> </math> of a beam of light that travels through air and then enters a material of unknown index of refraction. The student’s data for several incident angles are shown in the table.

<math alttext="theta sub i" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>θ</mi> <mi>i</mi> </msub> </math> (degrees)
 <math alttext="theta sub r" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></math> (degrees)

<math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math>
 <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="16" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn></math>
 <math alttext="10.8" overflow="scroll"><mn>10.8</mn></math>

<math alttext="32" overflow="scroll"><mn>32</mn></math>
 <math alttext="20.4" overflow="scroll"><mn>20.4</mn></math>

<math alttext="48" overflow="scroll"><mn>48</mn></math>
 <math alttext="30.1" overflow="scroll"><mn>30.1</mn></math>

<math alttext="64" overflow="scroll"><mn>64</mn></math>
 <math alttext="37.9" overflow="scroll"><mn>37.9</mn></math>

<math alttext="80" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn></math>
 <math alttext="39.8" overflow="scroll"><mn>39.8</mn></math>
content.question: Which of the following procedures should the student follow so that the slope of a best-fit line will be the index of refraction of the material?

choices.label: Graphing <math alttext="theta sub r" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></math> as a function of <math alttext="theta sub i" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>
Graphing <math alttext="theta sub i" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> as a function of <math alttext="theta sub r" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></math>

Graphing <math alttext="the sine of theta sub r" overflow="scroll"><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></math> as a function of <math alttext="the sine of theta sub i" overflow="scroll"><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>

Graphing <math alttext="the sine of theta sub i" overflow="scroll"><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> as a function of <math alttext="the sine of theta sub r" overflow="scroll"><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></math>

content.answer: Graphing <math alttext="the sine of theta sub i" overflow="scroll"><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> as a function of <math alttext="the sine of theta sub r" overflow="scroll"><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
